description: Successfully installed on Intel® Core™ i7-6770HQ CPU @ 2.60GHz × 8, Intel® Iris Pro Graphics 580 (Skylake GT4e) with Ubuntu 19.04

Allows IOT devices from various manufacturers to be used.
Runs on Linux and other hardware platforms
Easy to install and configure
Add Homebridge and you've got almost all devices running together

Weaknesses
Require maintenance
Although it's improved with Version 2, still bugs do exist
Major releses can include unsupported features, read, read ... read again

System gets into a terrible state upon halfway-installation such that a manual hack is required to get the snap daemon to function again (one cpu becomes totally locked up--killing the process or even restarting doesn't help and openhab never fully installs and won't uninstall--it gets stuck in limbo state making it impossible to install any more snaps that is unique to this snap). Needs work for aarch64. arm64 people, you have been warned. I had to unmount the internal snap dir manually and delete it to recover.
summary: On aarch64 this snap build causes runaway cpu on apparmor parser
